title:
Minimal residual discretization of a class of fully nonlinear elliptic
  PDE
authors: Dietmar Gallistl and Ngoc Tien Tran
abstract:
This work introduces finite element methods for a class of elliptic fully
nonlinear partial differential equations. They are based on a minimal residual
principle that builds upon the Alexandrov--Bakelman--Pucci estimate. Under
rather general structural assumptions on the operator, convergence of $C^1$
conforming and discontinuous Galerkin methods is proven in the $L^\infty$ norm.
Numerical experiments on the performance of adaptive mesh refinement driven by
local information of the residual in two and three space dimensions are
provided.
